description.narrative:
Since January 2018, CAFOB has been an implementing partner of the farmers' voice project. CAFOB's accounting system accuses breaches. The project consists of updating CAFOB's Sage Saari accounting system and training Sage Saari software for the personnelconcerned(Accounting and Finance)
Objective of the mini project
This mini-project emerged from the update of CAFOB's risk response. Since the finding of her faulty accounting system, she has expressed her need for an efficient accounting system arguing that her system needed updating. The objective of the mini-project is to equip Fopabu with the tools and skills enabling it to produce reliable financial reports for itself and for its partners.
Beneficiaries:
The CAFOB finance and accounting department will benefit from the accounting software and the staff of this department will be trained in Sage Saari software.
Result:
The finance department produces reliable reports through the use of Saage software.

participating-org.narrative:
The Collective of Associations and Women's NGOs of Burundi, CAFOB in acronym, is a Non-profit Non-Governmental Organization, created in 1994 on the initiative of seven women's associations and with the Canadian Center for Studies and International Cooperation (CECI) in highlight of the crisis that shook Burundi. It was registered at the Ministry of the Interior on January 20, 1997 under number 530/044. CAFOB is the oldest and largest collective of women's non-governmental organizations and associations of Burundian civil society, which now has 72 functional associations.
Vision A peaceful and prosperous Burundi that respects the rights of the human person and where the woman has the same opportunities as the man and decide together for the future of the country.
Mission - Strengthen the operational capacities of women's associations and NGOs in Burundi - Train associations to be effective actors in peace, gender and development.
OBJECTIVES
- Strengthen the operational capacity of women's associations and NGO members; - Promote the emergence of women's leadership and the full participation of women in the Burundian development process. - To campaign for the participation of Burundian women in civil, political and economic life

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

description.narrative: Strengthened CSOs: # National CSOs increasingly participate in or initiate influencing and advocacy efforts on (i) Sustainable Food production and consumption, (ii) Land Rights and (iii) Climate Change with a gender senstive lens.
